questions.title: Mixed Unicode and LaTeX Test
questions.question_text: A resistor R = 75Ω is connected in parallel with an inductor L = 50mH. The admittance Y at frequency ω = 377rad/s is given by: $$Y = \frac{1}{R} + \frac{1}{j\omega L}$$ where j = √-1. Calculate |Y|.
questions.feedback_incorrect: Remember: For an inductor, X_L = ωL and the admittance is Y = 1/R - j/(ωL)

questions.title: Greek Letters and Symbols Test
questions.question_text: For a sinusoidal signal v(t) = Vm sin(ωt + φ), where Vm = 120V, ω = 2πf with f = 60Hz, and φ = 30°, calculate the instantaneous value at t = 5ms. Use π ≈ 3.14159.
questions.feedback_incorrect: Check your angle calculation: ωt + φ = 377×0.005 + 30°×π/180° in radians

questions.title: Complex Mathematical Expressions
questions.question_text: The Fourier transform of a rectangular pulse p(t) with width T and amplitude A is: $$P(ω) = AT \frac{\sin(ωT/2)}{ωT/2} = AT \text{sinc}\left(\frac{ωT}{2π}\right)$$ If A = 5V and T = 2μs, find P(ω) at ω = π×10⁶ rad/s.
questions.feedback_incorrect: Use P(ω) = AT×sin(ωT/2)/(ωT/2) with ω = π×10⁶, T = 2×10⁻⁶, A = 5

questions.title: Unit and Symbol Consistency Test
questions.question_text: For a capacitor with C = 100μF charged to V₀ = 12V, the stored energy is W = ½CV₀² = ½×100×10⁻⁶×144 = 7.2mJ. The power dissipated during discharge through R = 1kΩ follows P(t) = (V₀²/R)e⁻²ᵗ/τ where τ = RC.
questions.feedback_correct: True! Energy W = ½×100×10⁻⁶×12² = 7.2×10⁻³J = 7.2mJ, and P(t) = V₀²/R × e⁻²ᵗ/ᴿᶜ is correct
questions.feedback_incorrect: Check the energy formula W = ½CV² and power P(t) = V²(t)/R where V(t) = V₀e⁻ᵗ/ᴿᶜ

questions.title: Advanced Mathematical Notation
questions.question_text: The impedance of a transmission line with characteristic impedance Z₀ = 50Ω, terminated with load ZL = 25 + j25Ω, at distance ℓ from the load is: $$Z(ℓ) = Z_0 \frac{Z_L + jZ_0\tan(βℓ)}{Z_0 + jZ_L\tan(βℓ)}$$ where β = 2π/λ. For ℓ = λ/8, find |Z(ℓ)|.
questions.feedback_incorrect: Use βℓ = 2π×λ/8/λ = π/4, so tan(βℓ) = tan(π/4) = 1

questions.title: Encoding Issues Test - Corrupted Unicode
questions.question_text: A three-phase system has line voltages VL = 480V. The phase voltage is Vph = VL/√3. If each phase carries current Iph = 25A at power factor cos(φ) = 0.85 lagging, find the total real power P = 3×Vph×Iph×cos(φ) in kW.
questions.feedback_incorrect: Remember: For a wye connection, Vph = VL/√3, and P = 3VphIphcos(φ)

questions.title: Mixed Symbols and Encoding Test
questions.question_text: In a RLC series circuit: R = 10Ω, L = 50mH, C = 100μF. The resonant frequency f₀ is given by f₀ = 1/(2π√LC). At resonance, XL = XC and Z = R. Calculate f₀ and the quality factor Q = ωL/R.

questions.title: Special Characters and Spacing
questions.question_text: Ohm's law states V = IR. For a resistor with R = 2.2kΩ ± 5% carrying current I = 5.5mA ± 2%, the voltage is V = _____ ± _____%.
questions.feedback_incorrect: Use V = IR = 2200Ω × 5.5×10⁻³A. For error: combine percentage errors using √(5² + 2²)

questions.title: Complex LaTeX with Unicode Mix
questions.question_text: The skin depth δ in a conductor at frequency f is: $$δ = \sqrt{\frac{2}{ωμσ}} = \sqrt{\frac{1}{πfμσ}}$$ where μ = μ₀μᵣ and σ is conductivity. For copper (σ = 5.8×10⁷S/m, μᵣ ≈ 1) at f = 1MHz, find δ.
questions.feedback_incorrect: Use δ = √(1/(πfμ₀σ)) with f = 10⁶Hz, μ₀ = 4π×10⁻⁷H/m, σ = 5.8×10⁷S/m

questions.title: Comprehensive Symbol Test
questions.question_text: A sinusoidal voltage v(t) = 170sin(377t + 30°) is applied across a series circuit with R = 50Ω, L = 200mH. Find: (a) RMS voltage VRMS = Vm/√2, (b) inductive reactance XL = ωL, (c) impedance magnitude |Z| = √(R² + XL²), and (d) current amplitude Im = Vm/|Z|.
questions.feedback_incorrect: Calculate step by step: VRMS, then XL = ωL, then |Z|, finally Im. The current amplitude Im is the answer expected.

metadata.subject: Advanced Electrical Engineering - LaTeX Test Suite
test_focus: Mixed inline and display math modes
